thread.title: Westbourne Park fire: Huge blaze rips through shop and flats in north London | London Evening Standard
thread.title_full: Westbourne Park fire: Huge blaze rips through shop and flats in north London | London Evening Standard

author: Fiona Simpson
title: Westbourne Park fire: Huge blaze rips through shop and flats in north London | London Evening Standard
text:
Shocking moment council warden 'attacked by man in litter row' 
Dozens of fire fighters battled a blaze as flames ripped through a shop and flats in north London . 
Some 72 fire fighters and officers worked to tackle the blaze which broke out in the ground floor of a shop, in Harrow Road, Westbourne Park, around 8.45am on Friday. 
Dramatic footage posted on social media showed huge clouds of thick grey smoke billow into the air above the busy shopping street. 
Andrew Potter, whose flat overlooks the fire, described the neighbourhood as "blanketed in smoke". Thick smoke: Witnesses described smoke 'blanketing the neighbourhood' (Andrew Potter) 
He told the Standard: "We smelt smoke in our flat and went outside to find the building across the road completely enveloped in smoke. 
"A number of fire crews are here and the cordon has been moved further back." 
A spokesman for London Fire Brigade said parts of the shop and flats above where ablaze. Black smoke: A shop set alight in Harrow Road, Westbourne Pa(Jamie Page/Twitter) 
He added that there had been no reports of any injuries. 
Harrow Road was sealed-off to traffic as fire crews worked to extinguish the fire.
